intro: Spiesia longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, which are modified inflorescences typical of the genus. Spiesia longibracteata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
